intro: Cymopterus grayanus var. purpureus, commonly known as the purple globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, purple-pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The species is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
